intro: Museniopsis texana, commonly known as the Texas museniopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it is often found in limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
